question: Which of the following is associated with Steven-Johnson syndrome?
Which one of these is not an inherited cancer?
Which one of the following dermatomes is most commonly affected by herpes zoster?

A 35-year-old presents with complaints of darkly colored urine, dark pigment deposition in the ear, dark spot in the white of the eye, and arthritis. She has been diagnosed with a rare disorder that is inherited as an autosomal recessive trait. What enzyme deficiency is responsible for this disease?
Which of the following is used to identify the number and structure of chromosomes in order to detect abnormalities?

A 65-year-old male farmer presents to the clinic with a 1.2 cm red, slightly raised plaque on his face. A biopsy of the lesion shows cytologic atypia, dyskeratosis, and hyperkeratosis limited to the basal cell layer. Which of the following conditions results in this lesion?
A 35-year-old pregnant female presents to the clinic with tan or brown patches that appear on the forehead, cheeks, chin, upper lip, and nose. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old female presents to the clinic with a pigmented lesion on her left hand. An excisional biopsy reveals a superficial spreading type of melanoma. Which of the following histologic features has the most important prognostic value in this patient?

answers.option: Degree of intraepidermal invasion by melanoma cells

question: A 14-year-old female with amenorrhea is concerned about her delayed onset of menstruation. She has a short stature, a wide webbed neck, a broad chest, and secondary sexual characteristics consistent with those of a much younger girl. What are the most likely chromosomal changes in this condition?
A 35-year-old male presents with a history of skin allergy with unknown etiology. Which of the following types of chronic dermatitis does this patient have?
A child undergoes surgery of a 5×5 cm nevus on the tip of his nose. Risk of malignancy depends on which of the following?
Tense bullae are characteristic of which of the following diseases?
An 8-year-old girl presented to the doctor's office with a complaint of inability to see. On examination, she had white hair, eyelashes, and skin. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following disorders causes bullae formation due to friction?
Which of the following statements regarding stratum spinosum is incorrect?

answers.option: Cell layers are held together by desmosomes
It is the thickest layer of the epidermis
Cells appear to have spines or prickles on their surfaces
Keratin filaments are assembled into tonofibrils

question: Which one of the following is the smallest unit of genetic material that can produce a phenotypic effect on mutation?

An elderly lady presents to the clinic with a history of a long-standing ulcer on her scalp that has been growing slowly for the past 18 months. The ulcer has raised, rolled edges, and is not healing. Which of the following is most likely to be seen in the biopsy of the lesion?

answers.option: Nests of basaloid cells with peripheral palisading
Clusters of nevus cells in the dermis
Invasive groups of squamous cells with keratin pearl formation

question: A hemophilic man marries a non-hemophilic woman, homozygous for the trait. What is the possibility that their child may have hemophilia?
How is it possible that males with a sickness die invariably, but the trait persists in the population?

answers.option: Some males have it recessively and consequently pass it on to their offsprings
Moms pass it on to one-half of their daughters, who serve as carriers
One-half of each male and female child inherits the trait and acts as a carrier

question: Which of the following conditions is true for phenylketonuria?

answers.option: It is an autosomal recessive trait associated with rudimentary ovaries in females
It is an X-linked recessive trait associated with mental retardation
It is an autosomal trisomy associated with mongolism
It is an autosomal recessive trait associated with mental retardation
It is an autosomal dominant trait associated with gynecomastia

question: A single recessive trait will be able to express its influence when it is present on which of the following chromosomes?

A 72-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with the complaint that she has noticed changes in one of the moles on her arm. It has become larger and the color has changed from a uniform brown to a mottled brown with blackish areas. The borders are irregular and it also itches and bleeds sometimes. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 22-year-old medical student presents with the complaint of having developed a new pigmented lesion on his arm. Examination reveals a well-circumscribed, uniformly dark-brown, slightly raised lesion measuring 4 mm in diameter. A biopsy reveals groups and clusters of pigmented nevus cells at the dermo-epidermal junction and in the dermis. Which of the following nevi does he most likely have?

A lady brings her 8-year-old daughter to the clinic saying that the child has developed multiple, small, rounded, hyperpigmented lesions on her nose and cheeks. The lesions get darker when she plays outside. On examination, the lesions are flat, brown, and multiple, and measure about 1-2 mm in diameter. A biopsy is performed and shows increased amounts of melanin pigment within basal keratinocytes. The density of melanocytes is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which skin lesion emerges due to infiltration of the epidermis by inflammatory cells or circulating blood cells?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding amniocentesis?

answers.option: It helps in detection of chromosomal abnormalities
It is a medical procedure for prenatal diagnosis
It helps in detecting infections perinatally
It plays a role in identifying sex prenatally

question: Which of the following is an autosomal dominant disease that involves the nervous system?
Which of the following is an indication that a recovering patient with a burn injury after treatment is out of danger and at a low risk of infection?

A 20-year-old male presented with itching over the scalp and dryness of the face for the last 6 weeks. He has similar episodes, especially in winter. On examination of the scalp and face, there were greasy yellowish scales, and the back of the ear, nasolabial fold, and eyebrows had erythematous patches with fine scales. What is the likely diagnosis?

An elderly homeless male has had a rash all over his body for two months. On examination, crusted, hyperkeratotic lesions were present mainly over the palms and soles. There is scaling and erythema all over the body, and the nails are also thickened and rough. What is the likely diagnosis?
Which of the following best corresponds to the histopathological features of pemphigus vulgaris?

answers.option: Focal acantholysis with a various pattern and negative direct immunofluorescence
Acantholytic dyskeratotic cells and parakeratotic columns with negative direct immunofluorescence
Dilapidated brick wall appearance with negative direct immunofluorescence
Intraepidermal acantholysis with chicken wire pattern IgG on direct immunofluorescence

question: An 87-year-old man presents with erythema and blistering of his chest and upper extremities. Examination shows tense bullae on an erythematous base. A skin biopsy reveals subepidermal blisters with inflammatory infiltrate with numerous eosinophils. Which of the following is true for the direct immunofluorescence findings regarding the diagnosis?

answers.option: Deposition of IgA at the dermo-epidermal junction
Deposition of IgM and fibrin around dermal blood vessels
Deposition of IgG and C3 in a fishnet pattern
Deposition of IgG and C1q around the hair follicles
Deposition of IgG and C3 in a linear fashion along the dermal basement membrane

question: A 2-year-old baby presented with itching all over the body for a few months. On examination, she had generalized dry skin and there were erythematous plaques of excoriation, hyperkeratosis over the cheeks, cubital fossa, and popliteal fossa. There is a positive history of asthma and allergic rhinitis in the family. What is the likely diagnosis?

A five-year-old boy presented with a few circular patches of hair loss over the scalp covered with fine grey scales for the last 2 months. It was associated with mild itching. Wood's lamp examination showed green fluorescent. There was no history of fever or lymphadenopathy. What is the likely diagnosis?

A 10-year-old boy presented with severe itching over the scalp for the last month. Itching was throughout the day. It was not associated with any change in shampoos. On examination, there are multiple small whitish structures seen over the occipital area, and the hair shaft is more pronounced on the occipital and parietal areas. What is the likely diagnosis?

An 8-year-old male child presented with an itchy rash over the body for the last 2 weeks. On examination, there are multiple papules over the finger webs and genitals, excoriation marks were also present over the limbs and trunks and a few linear raised lesions were present between the toes. On further details, his mother said her other child was also complaining of itch and their sleep is disturbed due to itching. What is the characteristic lesion of this condition?
